summary: Indonesia's PDP Law mandates compliance for all data transfers to the US within trade agreements. The PDP Law emphasizes individual consent and data security, impacting cross-border data flow. Non-compliance could result in penalties, including fines of up to 2% of annual revenue.

title: United Kingdom Passes Data Use and Access Act 2025
combined_text: United Kingdom Passes Data Use and Access Act 2025. natlawreview.com.
summary: The UK's Data Use and Access Act 2025 simplifies data sharing, potentially boosting data availability for AI, by streamlining processes. The Act prioritizes data privacy through enhanced security measures, including substantial fines reaching 4% of global turnover for violations.  New provisions support secure data access for research and innovation, fostering growth opportunities for data-driven businesses with clear guidelines.

title: Data variety: the silent killer of AI — and how to conquer It

summary: Data variety is a major obstacle for AI success requiring abstraction layers. AI quality relies heavily on data quality, demanding adaptable processing architectures. Building AI demands tools designed for handling diverse data formats and sources effectively.

title: Life With GDPR : Episode 114 : Navigating GDPR in Global Outsourcing with Inge Zwick | Thomas Fox - Compliance Evangelist

summary: GDPR compliance in global outsourcing requires careful vendor due diligence, assessing data protection practices. Data transfer impact assessments (DTIAs) are crucial, especially if transfers involve high-risk processing activities. Standard Contractual Clauses (SCCs) or other Article 46 transfer mechanisms facilitate lawful international data transfers.
